Treatment: Eczema is a chronic skin condition that requires regular skin care. Moisturizing the skin several times a day is essential. Flare-ups are treated with steroid creams to reduce inflammation. Avoiding triggers such as scented soaps, stress, and certain foods can help prevent future outbreaks. In severe cases, oral medications or light therapy may be needed.

Drugs.Name: Advantan
Drugs.Description: Anti-inflammatory cream for flare-up control.

Drugs.Name: CeraVe Moisturizing Cream
Drugs.Description: Intensive moisturizer for daily use.

Drugs.Name: Elidel
Drugs.Description: Non-steroid cream for long-term inflammation control.

Treatment: Allergic rhinitis is caused by allergens like pollen, dust, or pet dander. Treatment involves avoiding these triggers and using antihistamine tablets or nasal sprays to relieve symptoms. For persistent symptoms, corticosteroid nasal sprays are used. In some cases, allergen immunotherapy (allergy shots) can offer long-term relief.

Drugs.Name: Aerius
Drugs.Description: Antihistamine that relieves sneezing and nasal symptoms.

Drugs.Name: Nasonex
Drugs.Description: Steroid nasal spray that reduces inflammation.

Drugs.Name: Otrivine
Drugs.Description: Nasal decongestant for quick relief.

Treatment: PCOS treatment focuses on managing symptoms and improving quality of life. Lifestyle changes like a healthy diet and regular exercise help balance hormones. Birth control pills regulate periods and reduce acne. For women trying to conceive, medications to stimulate ovulation may be prescribed.

Drugs.Name: Diane 35
Drugs.Description: Hormonal contraceptive that helps with acne and period regulation.

Drugs.Name: Glucophage
Drugs.Description: Used to improve insulin sensitivity and hormonal balance.

Drugs.Name: Clomid
Drugs.Description: Used to stimulate ovulation for fertility treatment.

Treatment: Initial treatment includes rest, pain medications, and physical therapy to strengthen back muscles. Avoiding heavy lifting and practicing proper posture is crucial. In some cases, spinal injections or surgery may be necessary if the pain doesn't improve with conservative treatments.

Drugs.Name: Muscoril
Drugs.Description: Muscle relaxant for relieving spasms.

Drugs.Name: Theraflex
Drugs.Description: Joint supplement to support recovery.

Drugs.Name: Dolorex
Drugs.Description: Pain reliever for musculoskeletal discomfort.

Treatment: Anemia caused by iron deficiency is treated by increasing iron intake through diet (like red meat and leafy greens) and supplements. It's also important to treat the underlying cause, such as bleeding or poor absorption. Vitamin C may help enhance iron absorption.

Drugs.Name: Ferro Sanol
Drugs.Description: Iron supplement to treat deficiency.

Drugs.Name: Maltofer
Drugs.Description: Gentle iron supplement for daily use.

Drugs.Name: Ferrum Hausmann
Drugs.Description: Iron syrup often used in pregnancy or children.

Treatment: Tension headaches are often related to stress or muscle tension. Regular sleep, relaxation techniques, and proper posture help prevent them. Over-the-counter pain relievers can manage symptoms. For chronic cases, physical therapy and stress management may be required.

Drugs.Name: Minoset
Drugs.Description: Pain reliever for headache and body aches.

Drugs.Name: Nurofen
Drugs.Description: Anti-inflammatory painkiller.

Drugs.Name: Dolorex
Drugs.Description: Used for tension-related muscle pain.

Treatment: GERD occurs when stomach acid flows back into the esophagus. Treatment involves eating smaller meals, avoiding spicy/fatty foods, not lying down after eating, and losing weight if overweight. Acid-reducing medications help relieve symptoms and heal the esophagus.

Drugs.Name: Nexium
Drugs.Description: Reduces acid production and relieves heartburn.

Drugs.Name: Talcid
Drugs.Description: Antacid tablet that neutralizes stomach acid.

Drugs.Name: Maalox
Drugs.Description: Liquid antacid for quick relief of reflux symptoms.

Treatment: Tonsillitis is usually viral and clears on its own with rest, fluids, and pain relief. If it's caused by bacteria (such as strep throat), antibiotics may be needed. Recurrent infections might require surgical removal of the tonsils (tonsillectomy).

Drugs.Name: Parol
Drugs.Description: Used to reduce pain and fever.

Drugs.Name: Augmentin
Drugs.Description: Antibiotic used in bacterial tonsillitis.

Drugs.Name: Strepsils
Drugs.Description: Throat lozenge for sore throat relief.

Treatment: Astigmatism is a common eye condition that causes blurry vision due to irregular cornea shape. It’s corrected using prescription eyeglasses or contact lenses. In some cases, refractive surgery (like LASIK) may be considered.

CFS treatment focuses on symptom management. Gentle physical activity, cognitive behavioral therapy, sleep improvement techniques, and stress reduction are recommended. There’s no specific cure, so a holistic, supportive approach is best.

Drugs.Name: Lyrica
Drugs.Description: Helps relieve nerve and muscle pain associated with CFS.

Drugs.Name: Mirtazapine
Drugs.Description: Used to improve sleep in CFS patients.

Treatment: IBS is managed through dietary changes, such as increasing fiber or avoiding trigger foods. Stress management and regular exercise are important. Medications may help control symptoms like diarrhea or constipation, but long-term success often comes from lifestyle adjustments and a personalized diet plan.

Drugs.Name: Duspatalin
Drugs.Description: Relieves abdominal cramps and spasms.

Drugs.Name: Debridat
Drugs.Description: Regulates bowel movement.

Drugs.Name: Normolyt
Drugs.Description: Electrolyte solution for hydration in diarrhea.

Treatment: Treatment includes nasal saline sprays to clear mucus and corticosteroid sprays to reduce inflammation. In bacterial cases, antibiotics may be used. Steam inhalation and rest can ease symptoms. Chronic cases might require ENT evaluation for surgical options.

Drugs.Name: Rhinocort
Drugs.Description: Nasal spray that reduces swelling and mucus.

Drugs.Name: Augmentin
Drugs.Description: Antibiotic used if infection is bacterial.

Drugs.Name: Otrivine
Drugs.Description: Nasal decongestant for short-term relief.

Treatment: This condition is treated with daily hormone replacement therapy to normalize thyroid hormone levels. Regular blood tests are required to adjust the dose. Symptoms typically improve within weeks of starting treatment.

Drugs.Name: Euthyrox
Drugs.Description: Daily hormone replacement.

Treatment: Treatments include medications to reduce thyroid hormone production, radioactive iodine to destroy overactive thyroid tissue, or surgery in some cases. Beta blockers may be used to control symptoms like palpitations.

Drugs.Name: Propycil
Drugs.Description: Reduces thyroid hormone levels.

Drugs.Name: Beloc
Drugs.Description: Controls heart rate and tremors.

Treatment: Pneumonia is treated based on its cause: bacterial types require antibiotics, while viral types usually resolve with rest, hydration, and fever control. In severe cases, hospitalization and oxygen therapy may be necessary.

Drugs.Name: Macrol
Drugs.Description: Antibiotic used for respiratory infections.

Drugs.Name: Parol
Drugs.Description: Pain and fever reducer.

Drugs.Name: Ventolin
Drugs.Description: Helps open the airways and ease breathing.
